page.title: 05IRVINE RAILWAY STATION
page.content: This station has been in existence since 1840 with the opening of the Glasgow,Paisley,Dalry,Kilwinning, Irvine and Ayr line which was built by a company of businessmen who were promoting trade.The line was run later by the London Midland and Scottish Railway Company and is now part of Scotrail.At the moment the line running between Irvine and Glasgow is undergoing electrification at a cost of Â£80,000,000, doing away with diesel locomotives.The advantages of the scheme are that the trains will be quicker, cleaner and more economical.Unfortunately parts of the line south of Ayr will not be electrified in the near future and passengers going to Stranraer will have to change at Ayr to diesel locos.
